column2: [From.GetFirstName] was sacrificed to the cruel [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] gods! Accounts describe how [From.GetSheHe] was forcefully dragged screaming into a guillotine and beheaded by mad priests.

The judges of [FromFrom.GetFirstName] drag you to the sacred guillotine, they place you into the stocks, someone pulls the lever, and the blade cut off your head. Your last vision is Madame Guillotine with a smiling face.

The priests of [FromFrom.GetFirstName] drag you to the their so called sacred guillotine, they place you into the stocks, someone pulls the lever, and the blade cut off your head, as your world fades away.
I'm with you now, Madame Guillotine!

The judges drag [From.GetFirstName] screaming to the sacred guillotine, they place [From.GetHerHim] into the stocks, pull the lever, and the blade cut off [From.GetHerHis] head. It falls into the basket with still rolling eyes to the cheers of the assembled crowd.

The judges drag [From.GetFirstName] screaming to the sacred guillotine, they place [From.GetHerHim] into the stocks, then you pull the lever, and the blade cut off [From.GetHerHis] head. It falls into the basket and you raise it high to the cheers of the assembled crowd.

The judges drag [From.GetFirstName] screaming to the sacred guillotine, they place [From.GetHerHim] into the stocks, then you pull the lever myself for the first time, and the blade cut off [From.GetHerHis] head. It falls into the basket and after a little hesitation you raise it high to the cheers of the assembled crowd.
[Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName], tell me what is the message of Madame Guillotine!
Madame Guillotine, help me, I'm going to read your message!

[message_reader.GetFirstName] takes out the head of [FromFrom.GetFirstName] from your hand, and begins to examine the blood drops in the basket. Everyone watches [message_reader.GetHerHim] silently for a few minutes then [message_reader.GetSheHe] suddenly rises [message_reader.GetHerHis] head and shouts "Madame Guillotine has nothing to tell us this time". The crowd murmurs then scatters.

You keep holding the head of [FromFrom.GetFirstName], and begin to examine the blood drops in the basket. As everyone watches you silently, you try to figure out what the goddess want to say to us but can't find any of the holy patterns in the blood. Finally, when you can't make the people wait any longer, you raise your head and shout "Madame Guillotine has nothing to tell us this time". The crowd murmurs then scatters.
This moron should be sacrificed too.
Madame Guillotine, I have failed you!

[message_reader.GetFirstName] begins to examine the blood drops in the basket. [message_reader.GetSheHeCap] doesn't move for a few minutes, then rises [message_reader.GetHerHis] head, and declares the message of the goddess: "Madame Guillotine desires those life who [Root.GetNewPreference]." [Root.GetCrownReaction]

You begin to examine the blood drops in the basket. You watch it for a few minutes, and recognise a few of the holy patterns in the blood. You rise your head and declare the message of the goddess: "Madame Guillotine desires those life who [Root.GetNewPreference]." [Root.GetCrownReaction]
Your wish is my command, Madame Guillotine!
Your wish is my command, Madame Guillotine!
I will propitiate you, Madame Guillotine!
I will propitiate you, Madame Guillotine!
I'm no foreteller, just a servant of yours, Madame Guillotine!
I'm no foreteller, just a servant of yours, Madame Guillotine!
[Root.GetBestName] will be sacrificed to Madame Guillotine.

For centuries, an ancient belief system has existed in Europe, though it has usually existed underground in small cabals or among the heights of academia. These people, called 'The Jacobins', believe firmly that the Event was caused by Europe's loss of fervour in the worship of the great goddess, Madame Guillotine. Following the teachings of the Prophet Robespierre, they hold that Madame Guillotine must constantly be sated with fresh blood, lest mankind be punished with a second Event. For most of their existence they have been persecuted for their insane and dangerous beliefs, but in recent days a charismatic young preacher has managed to convince many that the Second Event is nigh, and that dramatic action is necessary to avert the End. Hidden Jacobinists have arisen from their caves to aid him, bolstered by an army of peasants drawn by his apparent mystical powers and charismatic preaching. They now seek to war against the whole world, in order to save it.
Freedom is a representation of the devotion of this character to Madame Guillotine and the Jacobinist faith, making him more respected especially by the clergy.

With the Jacobinist revolution in full swing, an enthusiastic group of peasants has taken up the cause of defending the faith. Uniting under a trained soldier,the group has taken to calling themselves the 'Sans-Culottes',after the legendary heroes who walked with the Prophet Robespierre and slew his enemies in ancient days.
Hasn't sacrificed to Madame Guillotine for a long time
You will sacrifice a few peasant to make the goddess content.
You recently sacrificed to Madame Guillotine, therefore she is content for now.
Madame Guillotine wants regular sacrifices, but you haven't done it in a long time. You can sacrifice a few peasants and pay a small compensation to their family to satisfy her.
was sacrificed to Madame Guillotine on the order of $KILLER$
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! has proven that [Root.GetSheHe] is dedicated to Madame Guillotine, therefore [Root.GetSheHe] would be a better protector of Jacobinism.
Jacobinists can conquer single border counties without specific reasons.
Jacobinists can seize duchies from each other without specific reasons at the cost of §Y100§! Piety.
Fairly weak Jacobinist rulers can start a revolution for a kingdom at the cost of §Y500§! Prestige once in a lifetime.
Leaders of successful Jacobinist revolution can continue them.
Jacobinists can start a war for all of the de jure land of a held kingdom at the cost of §Y100§! Piety.
[Root.Religion.GetName]s can spread the revolution to new realms unlimited times but these states won't have any obligations to their liberators.
[Root.Religion.GetName]s can spread the revolution to new realms unlimited times but these states won't have any obligations to their liberators.
The §Y[This.GetFullBaseName]§! will be liberated under a new ruler of the §Y[Root.Religion.GetName]§! religion!

§Y*§! Instead of Holy Wars, Jacobinist rules have access to a unique set of Casus Bellis (County Conquests, Seize same faith Duchies, Spread the Revolution and start Revolution).\n§Y*§! Can make sacrifices to Madame Guillotine and lose Piety if they don't do it for a long time.\n§Y*§! Model Citizens can start war for The Comíte de Salut Publique.

You begin to examine the blood drops in the basket. You recognise some rather special holy symbols in it, so you immediately declare the message of the goddess: "Madame Guillotine desires a young French girl, named Élodie, living near Paris, and chosen me to fulfill her demand." The crowd impatiently waits for my response.
I will find her for you, Madame Guillotine!
I would rather not waste my time with it.
